GitHub user arunmahadevan opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1343

STORM-1714 StatefulBolts ends up as normal bolts while using TopologyBuilder.setBolt without parallelism

Refactored IstatefulBolt to be independent of IRichBolt so that setBolt overloads in TopologyBuilder can work correctly.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/arunmahadevan/storm STORM-1714

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1343.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1343

githubbot:

Github user HeartSaVioR commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1329#issuecomment-211142407

@harshach Yes sure, #1330 is ready for reviewing. Could you review that as well?

Thanks for the update.
Btw, I intended to not add incr\* cause Storm provides 'at least once' so they makes flawed result when tuples are replayed.

How about adding GEO commands? It's planned to being introduced as Redis 3.2.0 (currently RC3).
Jedis already supports GEO commands on 2.8.0 and latest releases for Jedis is 2.8.1.

kabhwan:

I removed fix version cause I think it's also valid on 1.x.
Yes `GEO` is a new feature in `Redis 3.2` and I open a new ticket [Support GEO in storm-redis](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/STORM-1720)

githubbot:

Github user darionyaphet commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1346#issuecomment-211168882

Yes `GEO` is a new feature in `Redis 3.2` and I open a new ticket [Support GEO in storm-redis](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/STORM-1720)

@HeartSaVioR  When streaming replay , the `INCR` may work duplicate . But I think user should use checkpoint to save streaming processing status and restart from the checkpoint after the topology shutdown .

GitHub user HeartSaVioR opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1347

STORM-1719 Introduce REST API: Topology metric stats for stream

  • Path: /api/v1/topology/:id/metrics
  • This API provides detailed metrics for topology
    • shows metrics per component, which are aggregated by stream
  • add documentation about new REST API

I don't address this for master yet since ui/core.clj is not converted to Java but stats.clj is converted to Java.
If we want to move some methods in this patch to stats.clj, I'll follow up reviews, and start working on crafting patch against master when patch is ready to merge.

Sample output is here.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/HeartSaVioR/storm STORM-1719-1.x

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1347.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1347

commit a1c647142816ffb92bbaa6acbf234fdd83c3441e
Author: Jungtaek Lim
Date: 2016-04-16T11:04:01Z

STORM-1719 Introduce REST API: Topology metric stats for stream

  • Path: /api/v1/topology/:id/metrics
  • This API provides detailed metrics for topology
    • shows metrics per component, which are aggregated by stream
  • add documentation about new REST API
    • please refer docs/STORM-UI-REST-API.md for details

@darionyaphet 
Unfortunately, Storm doesn't guarantee exactly-once unless you use Trident with appropriate Spout and State. Checkpointing doesn't guarantee exactly-once.
http://storm.apache.org/releases/1.0.0/State-checkpointing.html
http://storm.apache.org/releases/1.0.0/Trident-state.html
@HeartSaVioR It's seems I make a mistake.  `pull request #1` is a merge request I commit long time ago. I couldn't checkout it . Maybe I should remove this repo and recommit this PR ?
@darionyaphet Yeah, if `git rebase master` doesn't work, you may want to create a new branch and try to cherry pick b3c0e2d.
@HeartSaVioR thanks for you help . I will close this pull request and reopen another . 👍

githubbot:

Github user darionyaphet closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1345
@HeartSaVioR understood ! So `Redis Bolt` should be idempotency .

@darionyaphet 
Non-idempotent implementation of bolt should be used with caution, so instead of making any confusion or error-prone, I'd love for users to create their own bolt via extending AbstractRedisBolt when they want to use it with risk.

githubbot:

Github user HeartSaVioR commented on a diff in the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1343#discussion_r60014901

— Diff: storm-core/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/topology/CheckpointTupleForwarder.java —
@@ -53,6 +53,10 @@
private long lastTxid = Long.MIN_VALUE;
private AnchoringOutputCollector collector;

+ public CheckpointTupleForwarder() {
— End diff –

Do we need this constructor? Especially it will incur NPE since this.bolt is accessed from various methods.

githubbot:

Github user HeartSaVioR commented on a diff in the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1343#discussion_r60016236

— Diff: storm-core/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/topology/CheckpointTupleForwarder.java —
@@ -53,6 +53,10 @@
private long lastTxid = Long.MIN_VALUE;
private AnchoringOutputCollector collector;

+ public CheckpointTupleForwarder() {
— End diff –

Oh I'm seeing StatefulBoltExecutor extends this class.

IMO StatefulBoltExecutor extending CheckpointTupleForwarder could make us confusing, since StatefulBoltExecutor always call default constructor of CheckpointTupleForwarder, which means that StatefulBoltExecutor should hide all methods which access (directly or indirectly) this.bolt to avoid NPE.

Could we introduce base class extracting common logic from CheckpointTupleForwarder?

githubbot:

— Diff: storm-core/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/topology/IStatefulBolt.java —
@@ -27,5 +32,17 @@

  • state updates. The stateful bolts are expected to anchor the tuples while emitting
  • and ack the input tuples once its processed.


    */
    -public interface IStatefulBolt extends IStatefulComponent, IRichBolt {
    +public interface IStatefulBolt extends IStatefulComponent {
      • End diff –

Good fix.

— Diff: storm-core/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/topology/CheckpointTupleForwarder.java —
@@ -53,6 +53,10 @@
private long lastTxid = Long.MIN_VALUE;

— End diff –

Since the IStatefulBolt is no longer an IRichBolt it cannot be passed to the base class. Makes sense to move the common functionality to a base class which both StatefulBoltExecutor and CheckpointTupleForwarder inherit to avoid the confusion. Will do the refactoring.

rpcmoritz:

Sadly, this didn't make it in time for 1.0.0 - I added the version, would be great to add the fix versions once this makes it into a release.
Such a major and potentially incompatible dependency change should be treated with care - potentially we should look at Maven profiles for the different major versions of the included adapter classes?
With these changes, many .txt files will be output. So I closed this.
